title.narrative: IOM Libya COVID-19 Preparedness and Response Plan 2021

description.narrative: Through this project, IOM will contribute to support the Libyan authorities to respond to the most urgent needs of at-risk populations in Libya, including migrants and internally displaced persons (IDPs), whose vulnerabilities have been further exacerbated by the COVID19 pandemic while promoting equitable access to the COVD19 vaccines for all, including migrants. The project includes three areas of intervention: addressing the needs of migrants in detention centres and work to reduce the likelihood of infection spread by providing hygiene kits and facilitating increased awareness among migrants and other vulnerable populations on methods of transmission and prevention; equipping up to six detention centres to respond to COVID19 outbreaks by providing personal protective equipment (PPE); equipping authorities in six points of entry with PPEs and increasing their awareness of measures to protect themselves and travelers from COVID19 transmission. The project is in line with the IOM Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan-Coronavirus Disease 2019[1] and the World Health Organization (WHO) Preparedness and Response Plan for Libya - specifically on infection control and prevention, particularly of most vulnerable populations and point of entry. The project is also in line with the Global Humanitarian Response Plan and contributes to the Sustainable Development Goals 3, 6 and 10.

mailing-address.narrative: Basset Str, Near Gurnata Villa Hay El Andalos, Tripoli, Libya

sector.narrative: Migr Health Assist for Crisis Aff Pops

policy-marker.narrative: Project with sufficient inclusion of gender issues (mainstreamed)
